data.chText: 桩；标桩；篱笆桩
data.enText: a wooden or metal post that is pointed at one end and pushed into the ground in order to support sth, mark a particular place, etc.

data.chText: 火刑柱
data.enText: a wooden post that sb could be tied to in former times before being burnt to death (= killed by fire) as a punishment

data.chText: 圣女贞德被处以火刑。
data.enText: Joan of Arc was burnt at the stake .

data.chText: 股本；股份
data.enText: money that sb invests in a company

data.chText: 那家公司20%的股份
data.enText: a 20% stake in the business

data.chText: （在公司、计划等中的）重大利益，重大利害关系
data.enText: an important part or share in a business, plan, etc. that is important to you and that you want to be successful

data.chText: 这出戏成功与否对她个人有重大利害关系。
data.enText: She has a personal stake in the success of the play.

data.chText: 很多年轻人不再觉得他们与社会休戚相关。
data.enText: Many young people no longer feel they have a stake in society.

data.chText: 赌注
data.enText: something that you risk losing, especially money, when you try to predict the result of a race, game, etc., or when you are involved in an activity that can succeed or fail

data.chText: 下了多少注？
data.enText: How much was the stake (= how much did you bet) ?

data.chText: 他们当时正在打扑克，赌注很高。
data.enText: They were playing cards for high stakes (= a lot of money) .

data.chText: 赛马奖金
data.enText: the money that is paid to the winners in horse racing

data.chText: （用于某些赛马的名称）…赛
data.enText: used in the names of some horse races
at stake

data.chText: 成败难料；得失都可能；有风险
data.enText: that can be won or lost, depending on the success of a particular action

data.chText: 现在人命交关，不容我们有闪失。
data.enText: We cannot afford to take risks when peoples' lives are at stake.

data.chText: 这次如果获胜，便能进入决赛。
data.enText: The prize at stake is a place in the final.
go to the stake over/for sth

data.chText: 为坚持自己的观点（或信仰）甘冒一切危险；为维护自己的观点（或信仰）不惜赴汤蹈火
data.enText: to be prepared to do anything in order to defend your opinions or beliefs
in the… stakes

data.chText: （评论一个人的某种品质高或低）要是比…的话，论…
data.enText: used to say how much of a particular quality a person has, as if they were in a competition in which some people are more successful than others

data.chText: 论人格魅力，约翰很一般。
data.enText: John doesn't do too well in the personality stakes.

data.chText: （就某事）以…打赌，拿…冒险
data.enText: to risk money or sth important on the result of sth

data.chText: 他在那匹众人看好的马上押了25英镑。
data.enText: He staked £25 on the favourite (= for example, in horse racing) .

data.chText: 她把自己的政治前程押在税制改革上，结果赌输了。
data.enText: She staked her political career on tax reform, and lost.

data.chText: 就是那边那个人——我敢拿脑袋打赌。
data.enText: That's him over there─I'd stake my life on it (= I am completely confident) .

data.chText: 用桩支撑
data.enText: to support sth with a stake(1)

data.chText: 用木桩支撑新植的树
data.enText: to stake newly planted trees
stake (out) a/your claim (to/for/on sth)

data.chText: 公开宣布自己（对某物）的所有权；向公众表示某物应属于自己
data.enText: to say or show publicly that you think sth should be yours

data.chText: 亚当斯昨天轻松获胜，这无异于告诉人们奥运代表队中应有他的位置。
data.enText: Adams staked his claim for a place in the Olympic team with his easy win yesterday.
stake sth↔out

data.chText: 清楚地界定自认为属于自己的东西
data.enText: to clearly mark the limits of sth that you claim is yours

data.chText: 明确阐述自己的看法（或立场等）
data.enText: to state your opinion, position, etc. on sth very clearly

data.chText: 总统明确阐述了他在这个问题上的立场。
data.enText: The President staked out his position on the issue.

data.chText: 监视
data.enText: to watch a place secretly, especially for signs of illegal activity

data.chText: 侦探们已对这所房子监视了几个星期。
data.enText: Detectives had been staking out the house for several weeks.

word_means: 重大利益，重大利害关系

means: 重大利益，重大利害关系

ex.chText: 我们在那匹马上下了很大的赌注。
ex.enText: We gambled heavily on that horse.

synonyms.bx: 指为获得钱物而在纸牌、赛马等中投机冒险。

ex.chText: 我同你打赌5美元英国队会赢得世界杯。
ex.enText: I bet you 5 dollars that the British team will win the World Cup.

ex.chText: 他在那匹白马上下了50美元的赌注。
ex.enText: He bet $50 on the white horse.
I bet that he wouldn't come.

synonyms.bx: 多指对比赛等打赌，也指双方对有疑惑、争执之事打赌。

ex.chText: 我将把我的名誉赌在这个结果上。
ex.enText: I will stake my good reputation on the outcome.

ex.chText: 他把所有的钱都押在这桩有风险的生意上。
ex.enText: He staked all his money on the risky business.

synonyms.bx: 指用贵重或重要之物当赌注，如名誉、财产等，通常与介词 on 连用。

data.enText: at stake

data.chText: 成败难料；得失都可能；有风险
data.enText: that can be won or lost, depending on the success of a particular action

data.chText: 现在人命交关，不容我们有闪失。
data.enText: We cannot afford to take risks when peoples' lives are at stake.

data.chText: 这次如果获胜，便能进入决赛。
data.enText: The prize at stake is a place in the final.
go to the stake over/for sth

data.chText: 为坚持自己的观点（或信仰）甘冒一切危险；为维护自己的观点（或信仰）不惜赴汤蹈火
data.enText: to be prepared to do anything in order to defend your opinions or beliefs
in the… stakes

data.chText: （评论一个人的某种品质高或低）要是比…的话，论…
data.enText: used to say how much of a particular quality a person has, as if they were in a competition in which some people are more successful than others

data.chText: 论人格魅力，约翰很一般。
data.enText: John doesn't do too well in the personality stakes.
up sticks
pull up stakes

data.chText: 突然迁居
data.enText: to suddenly move from your house and go to live somewhere else
stake (out) a/your claim (to/for/on sth)

data.chText: 公开宣布自己（对某物）的所有权；向公众表示某物应属于自己
data.enText: to say or show publicly that you think sth should be yours

data.chText: 亚当斯昨天轻松获胜，这无异于告诉人们奥运代表队中应有他的位置。
data.enText: Adams staked his claim for a place in the Olympic team with his easy win yesterday.
stake sth↔out

data.chText: 清楚地界定自认为属于自己的东西
data.enText: to clearly mark the limits of sth that you claim is yours

data.chText: 明确阐述自己的看法（或立场等）
data.enText: to state your opinion, position, etc. on sth very clearly

data.chText: 总统明确阐述了他在这个问题上的立场。
data.enText: The President staked out his position on the issue.

data.chText: 监视
data.enText: to watch a place secretly, especially for signs of illegal activity

data.chText: 侦探们已对这所房子监视了几个星期。
data.enText: Detectives had been staking out the house for several weeks.

trans: 明确表明，清楚界定（立场、要求等）

tr: a strong wooden or metal post with a point at one end so it can be driven into the ground
instrument of execution consisting of a vertical post that a victim is tied to for burning
a pole or stake set up to mark something (as the start or end of a race track)
example: a pair of posts marked the goal
the corner of the lot was indicated by a stake

tr: (law) a right or legal share of something
example: they have interests all over the world
a stake in the company's future

tr: the money risked on a gamble

example: I'm betting on the new horse

tr: kill by piercing with a spear or sharp pole
example: the enemies were impaled and left to die

tr: tie or fasten to a stake

example: I will stake my good reputation for this

value.def: If something is at stake, it is being risked and might be lost or damaged if you are not successful.

example.ex: The tension was naturally high for a game with so much at stake...
example.tran: 对于一场成败攸关的比赛来说气氛自然非常紧张。

example.ex: At stake is the success or failure of world trade talks...
example.tran: 世界贸易谈判正处于成败的重要关头。

example.ex: At stake are more than 20,000 jobs in Britain's aerospace sector.
example.tran: 英国航天部门 2 万多人面临失业的危险。

value.tran: 处于危险境地;处于成败关头

value.def: The stakes involved in a contest or a risky action are the things that can be gained or lost.

example.ex: The game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups...
example.tran: 游戏通常在两大集团之间进行，下的赌注一般都很大。

example.ex: By arresting the organisation's two top leaders the government and the army have now raised the stakes...
example.tran: 逮捕了该组织的两名主要头目后，政府和军队现在面临的风险更大了。

example.ex: For Mr Blair the political stakes could hardly have been higher.
example.tran: 对布莱尔来说，这已经是最高的政治赌注了。

value.def: If you stake something such as your money or your reputation on the result of something, you risk your money or reputation on it.

example.ex: He has staked his political future on an election victory...
example.tran: 他把自己的政治前途押在竞选获胜上。

example.ex: He has staked his reputation on the outcome.
example.tran: 他将自己的名声赌在了这个结果上。

value.def: If you have a stake in something such as a business, it matters to you, for example because you own part of it or because its success or failure will affect you.

example.ex: He was eager to return to a more entrepreneurial role in which he had a big financial stake in his own efforts...
example.tran: 他渴望回到一个更多参与创业的角色，那样他所付出的努力会与自己的经济利益息息相关。

example.ex: Detectives now believe the Mafia also had a stake in the plot and killed him when it went wrong.
example.tran: 侦探们现在相信黑手党在这个阴谋中也有利害关系，并在事败后杀了他。

value.tran: 利害关系;重大利益;(企业等中的)股本，股份

value.def: You can use stakes to refer to something that is like a contest. For example, you can refer to the choosing of a leader as the leadership stakes .

example.ex: Britain lags behind in the European childcare stakes.
example.tran: 英国在儿童保育方面落后于欧洲其他国家。

value.def: A stake is a pointed wooden post which is pushed into the ground, for example in order to support a young tree.
If you stake a claim, you say that something is yours or that you have a right to it.

example.ex: Jane is determined to stake her claim as an actress...
example.tran: 简决心主张自己作为一名女演员的权利。

example.ex: Baguet's success staked his claim for a place in Belgium's world championship team.
example.tran: 巴古埃特的成功使他有资格成为比利时世界锦标赛参赛队伍中的一员。

value.tran: 提出权利要求;主张权利

trans: 濒临险境；处于危险境地;处于成败关头
为某人取得某物而提供金钱；资助某人取得某物；给钱或借钱给某人买东西
受火刑，为自己的信仰或行动受难
明确表明，清楚界定（立场、要求等）
把赌注押在…上面，在…上打赌
